entries.title: Ukraine Will Get What It Needs to ‘Defend Itself and Succeed on the Battlefield,’ Biden Tells Zelensky
entries.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky holds a joint press conference with US President Joe Biden in the East Room of the White House, in Washington, DC on Dec. 21, 2022. (BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Actor Tim Robbins Decries COVID-19 Sanctimony, Demonization of Vaccine Skeptics
entries.description: Tim Robbins at the premiere of “Life of Crime.” Robbins plays Frank Dawson, a rich developer whose wife (Jennifer Aniston) is the target of a kidnapping scheme in Daniel Schechter’s comedy. (Evan Ning/Epoch Times)

entries.title: Less Than 5 Percent of Newly Purchased Vehicles by Feds Were Electric: Records
entries.description: An electric vehicle is charged in Ottawa on July 13, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: RCMP Official Accused of Leaking Classified Information Released on Bail
entries.description: Cameron Ortis, a former senior intelligence official with the RCMP charged with violating the Security of Information Act and breach of trust, leaves the courthouse in Ottawa after being granted bail on Oct. 22, 2019. (The Canadian Press/Justin Tang)

entries.title: Appeal Court Doubles Defamation Award to BC Businessman

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Gets Closer to China While Moving Away From US: Gregory Copley

entries.title: Zelenskyy Arrives For White House Meeting With Biden, Congressional Address
entries.description: U.S. President Joe Biden meets with Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the Oval Office at the White House on Dec. 21, 2022. (Leah Millis/Reuters)

entries.title: Public Safety Minister Hopes to Table First Nations Policing Legislation in New Year
entries.description: Minister of Public Safety Marco Mendicino speaks during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Oct. 4, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Experts Say F-35 Startup Costs Will Be High Due to Infrastructure, Network Upgrades
entries.description: A U.S. F-35 fighter jet flies over the Eifel Mountains near Spangdahlem, Germany, Feb. 23, 2022. (The Canadian Press/AP-dpa, Harald Tittel)

entries.title: Extreme Cold Warnings Blanket Western Canada as Winter Officially Arrives
entries.description: A person hails a taxi as heavy snow falls in downtown Vancouver, late Dec. 19, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: Canadians’ Generosity at Lowest Level in 2 Decades: Study
entries.description: A volunteer opens boxes of donated food items at a Sun Youth charity location in Montreal on July 11, 2022. (Graham Hughes/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Palestinian Support for ‘One China’ Policy Indicates Trouble in Middle East: Israeli Expert
entries.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas (L) shakes hands after presenting a medallion to Chinese leader Xi Jinping during a signing ceremony at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on July 18, 2017. (Mark Schiefelbein/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: UK Government and Health Unions Trade Blames Over Ambulance Strike
entries.description: Ambulances parked during a strike outside Waterloo ambulance station, London, on Dec. 21, 2022. (Kirsty O'Connor/PA Media)

entries.title: World Cup Celebrations in Buenos Aires Cut Short as Fans Clash With Riot Police
entries.description: A riot police officer fires a shotgun as they clear remaining soccer fans who waited for hours for a homecoming parade for the players who won the World Cup at the Obelisk in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Dec. 20, 2022. (Victor Caivano/AP Photo)

entries.title: Estranged Daughters of Condo Gunman Say He Was ‘Abusive Husband and Father’

entries.title: Ottawa’s Climate Reporting Goal Said to Be ‘Onerous’ for Small Business

entries.title: LIVE NOW: FTX Founder Bankman-Fried Leaves Bahamas Court
entries.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried (C) arrives at the Nassau, Bahamas, courthouse on December 21, 2022. - Onetime crypto-king Samuel Bankman-Fried could be extradited from the Bahamas to New York on Wednesday to stand trial for fraud, a source familiar with his case said Tuesday. (Photo by Kris INGRAHAM / AFP) (Photo by KRIS INGRAHAM/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Inflation in Canada Dropped Slightly in November but Food Prices Are Rising Faster
entries.description: People shop in a grocery store in Montreal, Wednesday, November 16, 2022. After enjoying 30 years of a relatively low and stable inflation rate, Canadians grappled with the highest levels of inflation seen in nearly four decades this year. (Graham Hughes/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Israeli Archaeologists Excavating ‘Jesus Midwife’ Tomb
entries.description: The interior of a 2000-year-old Second Temple-Period burial cave designated the Salome Cave that was recently uncovered in the Lachish Forest in Israel, on Dec. 20, 2022. (Maya Alleruzzo/AP Photo)

entries.title: Quebec Expanding Urgent-Care Phone Line to All Children Amid ER Overcrowding
entries.description: A sign for a hospital in Montreal, Feb. 6, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Graham Hughes)

entries.title: Messi’s World Cup Post Beats Egg to Become Most-Liked on Instagram
entries.description: Argentina's Lionel Messi celebrates with the trophy after winning the World Cup, during the match of Argentina v France in Lusail Stadium, Lusail, Qatar on Dec. 18, 2022. (Lee Smith/Reuters)

entries.title: Extreme Cold in Southern BC After Heavy Snow Creates Travel Chaos

entries.description: Imesh Ratnayake, 21, of Edmonton, allegedly lured upwards of 100 children to sexually assault them and create child pornography. (Alberta Law Enforcement Response Teams)

entries.title: North Korea Vows ‘Decisive Military Step’ Against Japan

(Korean Central News Agency/Korea News Service via AP)

entries.description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov attends an annual end-of-year news conference of Russian President Vladimir Putin, in Moscow on Dec. 23, 2021. (Evgenia Novozhenina/Reuters)

entries.description: People cross the road carefully as heavy snow hits northern Japan in the city of Niigata, on Dec. 19, 2022. (STR/JIJI Press/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Explosion Tears Through Russian Gas Pipeline During Repairs
entries.description: Firefighters work at the site of gas explosion, near the village of Yambakhtino, some 50km (31miles) south of Cheboksary, Chuvashia region, Russia, in a still from video released on Dec. 20, 2022. Ministry of Emergency Situations press service via AP)

entries.title: German Court Convicts 97-Year-Old Former Secretary at Nazi Camp

entries.description: Schoolgirls sit at the schoolyard in Herat on Aug. 17, 2021, following the Taliban takeover of the country. (Aref Karimi/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Male Scientists, It’s Time to Pack Your Bags

(Bill Denison/Drew University via Getty Images)

entries.title: Medical Device Makers Ending Production of Life-Saving Devices Due to New EU Law

entries.title: Amending the Constitution Is Not Necessary for Integration—Australia’s Migrant Story Tells Us So
entries.description: Participants in the Australia Day parade are seen as the walk down Swanston Street in Melbourne, Australia on Jan. 26, 2020. (Robert Cianflone/Getty Images)

entries.title: Michael Zwaagstra: Putting Students in Charge of Schools Is a Mistake
entries.description: Cracking down on bullying, maintaining orderly classrooms, and preventing physical altercations in the hallways are what school administrators should focus on. These are certainly the kinds of things that are now needed at Pinecrest Public School. (Illustration - Shutterstock)

entries.title: Trudeau Says No Elections in 2023, No Meeting With Premiers Unless Agreed Upon Deal
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau discusses dental care for children at Schulich School of Medicine and Dentistry in London, Ont., Dec. 1, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Nicole Osborne)

entries.title: National Citizen’s Inquiry Calls for Witnesses on Goverment Lockdowns
entries.description: Panelists at the “Citizens' Hearing”—an independent inquiry into Canada's pandemic response—listen to stories of Canadians adversely affected by COVID-19 vaccine mandates and restrictions, in Toronto on June 23, 2022. (L–R) Former Reform Party leader Preston Manning, retired Ontario pediatrician Dr. Susan Natsheh, and David Ross, president of the Canadian Covid Care Alliance. (Andrew Chen/The Epoch Times)
